text: Marc-André Bédard (15 August 1935 – 25 November 2020) was a Canadian attorney and politician. He was born in Lac-à-la-Croix, Quebec. Bédard was a member of the National Assembly of Quebec from 1973 to 1985. He was Minister of Justice and Deputy Premier. During the COVID-19 pandemic in Canada, he died from the infection on 25 November 2020 in at a hospital in Saguenay, Quebec at the age of 85. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Canadian politicians Category:Canadian lawyers Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Canada
title: Marc-André Bédard (politician)
